intro: Geniostoma rupestre var. rupestre, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
